intro: Stickmannia interrupta, commonly known as the interrupted stickman, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Stickmannia interrupta is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or wetland habitats.
